hints.label: def-adaptive-generator-cinf
hints.title: Adaptive Langevin Generator
hints.content:
825: :label: def-adaptive-generator-cinf
826: 
827: The **infinitesimal generator** of the adaptive Langevin dynamics on extended state w = (x, v):
828: 
829: $$
830: \mathcal{L} f(x, v) = v \cdot \nabla_x f + [-\nabla U(x) - \epsilon_F \nabla V_{\text{fit}}(x) - \gamma v] \cdot \nabla_v f + \frac{\gamma}{2\beta} \Delta_v f
831: $$
832: 
833: where:
834: - U(x): confining potential (backbone)
835: - ε_F ∇V_fit(x): adaptive force
836: - γ: friction
837: - Δ_v: velocity Laplacian (thermal noise)

hints.label: thm-essential-self-adjoint-cinf
hints.title: Essential Self-Adjointness (Conditional)
hints.content:
843: :label: thm-essential-self-adjoint-cinf
844: 
845: Assume:
846: 1. V_fit ∈ C∞(X) (Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-cinf-regularity`)
847: 2. U ∈ C∞(X) with lim_{||x|| → ∞} U(x) = +∞ (confining)
848: 3. V_total = U + ε_F V_fit satisfies liminf_{||x|| → ∞} V_total(x) / ||x||² > 0
849: 
850: Then the generator L is **essentially self-adjoint** on C_c^∞(X × ℝ^d).
851: 
852: **Implication**:
853: - Unique time evolution: e^{tL} uniquely determined
854: - Spectral theorem applies: L admits spectral decomposition
855: - No pathological behaviors
856: 
857: **Proof outline**: Apply Segal-Nelson theorem for Schrödinger-type operators:
858: 1. C_c^∞ dense in L² (true for ℝ^d)
859: 2. L symmetric on C_c^∞ (integration by parts requires C∞ coefficients - verified by our theorem)
860: 3. V_total grows at most quadratically (ensures semiboundedness)
